Submodules

auto_kappa.alamode.analyzer.analyzer module

auto_kappa.alamode.analyzer.analyzer.convert_gamma2tau(gammas)

Convert gamma[1/cm] to lifetime[ps]

Parameters:

gammas (ndarray, float, shape=(nk,nb)) – GAMMS written in .result file unit : Kayser[1/cm]

Returns:

lifetime – lifetime[ps]

Return type:

ndarray, float, shape=(nk,nb)

auto_kappa.alamode.analyzer.analyzer.get_average_at_degenerate_point(omega, tau, eps=0.001)

Average value for degenerate point

Parameters:

  • omega (ndarray, float, shape=(nk,nb)) – frequencies and lifetime, but any value is available for the secont variable.

  • tau (ndarray, float, shape=(nk,nb)) – frequencies and lifetime, but any value is available for the secont variable.

auto_kappa.alamode.analyzer.analyzer.get_heat_capacity(fkay, temp, min_fkay=1e-08)

calculate heat capacity

Parameters:

  • fkay (float) – frequency [1/cm]

  • temp (float) – temperature [K]

Returns:

cph – heat capacity [J/K]

Return type:

float

auto_kappa.alamode.analyzer.analyzer.get_kmode(volume, temp, frequencies, multiplicity, velocities, lifetime)

Calculate and return thermal conductivity of every modes

Parameters:

  • volume (float) – volume of a primitive unit cell [Bohr**3]

  • frequencies (ndarray, float, shape=(nk,nbands)) – eigenvalues [1/cm]

  • multiplicity (array, integer, shape=(nk)) – multiplicity

  • velocities (ndarray, float, shape=(nk,nbands,MULTI_MAX,3)) – group velocity [m/s]

  • lifetime (ndarray, float, shape=(nk,nbands)) – lifetime [ps]

  • nk (integer) – # of kpoints and bands

  • nbands (integer) – # of kpoints and bands

  • temp (float) – temperature [K]

  • mmax (integer) – maximum multiplicity

Returns:

kmode – thermal conductivity of each mode

Return type:

ndarray, float, shape=(nkpoints,nbands,3,3)

Read k points written in .self_isotope :param .kpoints: each k point :type .kpoints: ndarray, float, shape=(nk,3) :param .multiplicity: multiplicity :type .multiplicity: array, int, shape=(nk) :param .frequencies: eivenvalues :type .frequencies: ndarray, float, shape=(nk,3) :param .gammas: gamma due to isotope :type .gammas: ndarray, float, shape=(nk,3)

auto_kappa.alamode.analyzer.result.read_kpoint(filename)

Get number of kpoints :param fn: .result file name :type fn: string

Returns:

  • nk (integer) – number of irreducible kpoints

  • kpoints (ndarray, float, shape=(nk,3)) – k points

  • weights (array, float, shape=(nk)) – weights

auto_kappa.alamode.analyzer.result.read_relaxation_time(filename, ntemps, nk, nbands)

Get relaxation time :param filename: .result file name :type filename: string :param ntemps: # of temperatures, kpoints, and bands :type ntemps: integer :param nk: # of temperatures, kpoints, and bands :type nk: integer :param nbands: # of temperatures, kpoints, and bands :type nbands: integer

Returns:

  • multiplicity (array, int, shape=(nk)) – multiplicity

  • velocities (ndarray, float, shape=(nk, nbands, multiplicity, 3)) – velocities

  • gammas (ndarray, float, shape=(ntemps,nk,nbands)) – gammas due to ph-ph scattering

auto_kappa.alamode.analyzer.scattering module

class auto_kappa.alamode.analyzer.scattering.Scattering(file_result: None, temperature=300.0, file_isotope=None, grain_size=None, verbosity=0)

Bases: object

Hot To Use

>>> scat = Scattering(options.fresult,
>>>                 file_isotope=file_isotope,
>>>                 temperature=options.T,
>>>                 grain_size=size)
>>>
>>> scat.set_total_scattering_rate()
>>> print(scat.kappa)
>>>
>>>
>>> size = 1000   # nm
>>> scat.cahnge_grain_size(size)
>>>
>>> T = 100.
>>> scat.change_tempearture(T)

property frequencies
get_cumulative_kappa(temperature=300.0, grain_size=None, wrt='frequency', nbins=200, xscale='linear')

Return cumulative kappa w.r.t the given property, frequency or MFP.

Parameters:

wft (string) – “frequency” or “mfp”

Returns:

  • df (DataFrame)

  • df[‘xdat’] (array, shape=(nk*nb)) – values of the given property, frequency or MFP

  • df[‘kspec’] (array,) – cumulative kappa

  • df[‘kcumu’] (array,) – spectral kappa

get_kmin_cahill(bvec, temperature)
Parameters:

bvec (shape=(3,3), reciprocal vectors) –

Returns:

  • kappa (shape=())

  • kmode (shape=())

Example

>>>
>>> bvec = atoms.cell.get_reciprocal()
>>> kmin, kmode = scat.get_kmin_cahill(bvec, T)
>>>

set_scattering_rate_boundary(size=None)

Scattering rates due to grain boundaries are calculated with 2*|v|/L, where v and L are group velocities and grain size.
